sentences.english: By living only for the superficial, they aren’t able to find any meaning in life.
sentences.chinese: 因爲只爲表相而活，他們無法發現生活的真諦。

sentences.english: This is the essence of utilitarianism .
sentences.chinese: 這就是功利主義的真諦。

sentences.english: Being with them connects us to the deeper wisdom of life which is everpresent, and only asks to be lived.
sentences.chinese: 在和他們的交往中，我們學到的是生活的大智和真諦。

sentences.english: Is being this busy really the meaning of life?
sentences.chinese: 我們如此忙碌，難道就是是生命的真諦嗎？

sentences.english: So, for them these miserable couples offend the very idea of marriage?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，對於他們，這些可憐的夫婦違背了婚姻的真諦？

sentences.english: What makes the NBA playoffs great is that they reveal the true nature of a team.
sentences.chinese: NBA季後賽的偉大之處在於，它揭示了團隊的真諦。

sentences.english: The chances of finding a human existence are one in a hundred.
sentences.chinese: 只有百中之一的人才有機會尋找到人之生存真諦。

sentences.english: The great winds came and took them up into themselves.
sentences.chinese: 大風起兮，帶它們領悟自我的真諦去了。

sentences.english: Oh, mirror in the sky, what is love.
sentences.chinese: 哦，澄澈的天空，什麼纔是愛的真諦？

sentences.english: Life is half spent before we know what it is!
sentences.chinese: 生命過半，才能悟出人生的真諦。

sentences.english: It is written down on the book that a man who is proficient in the truth of Tao can accomplish everything.
sentences.chinese: 書中記載，只要精通道的真諦，天下事都能迎刃而解。

sentences.english: I doubt we shall not get much nearer to the nature of love by mere talking.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們只是紙上談兵，那就不可能瞭解到愛之真諦。

sentences.english: Neo-Syncretic:Show me the meaning of being lonely, Is this the feeling I need to walk with ?
sentences.chinese: 告訴我寂寞的真諦，這種感覺始終將伴隨我嗎？

sentences.english: Dreaming all these years, finally the right decision.
sentences.chinese: 歷經多年人生如夢，最後終於領悟生命的真諦。

sentences.english: The life of Kyokushin Karate is Kumite(fighting). The life of Kumite, fighting, is in basics.
sentences.chinese: 極真空手道的真諦在於對打，這是最基礎的。

sentences.english: That is what diplomacy is all about.
sentences.chinese: 這就是外交工作的真諦。

definition: (of Taoists) to practice austerities/to practice asceticism
a flash of realization/the truth in a flash/a moment of enlightenment (usually Buddhist)
to sublimate/sublimation (physics)/to raise to a higher level/to refine/promotion
to come to understand/to realize/consciousness/awareness/Buddhist enlightenment (Sanskrit: cittotpāda)
gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
this life/to lose face/to be disgraced
to master the subject via a comprehensive study of surrounding areas
